turns.speaker: user
turns.utterance: Hi, I'm calling about a charge on my recent bill. I was charged $75, but my plan is supposed to be $50. I'm really frustrated because this keeps happening.

turns.speaker: agent
turns.utterance: Hello, I understand your frustration. I'm sorry you're experiencing this again. Can I get your account number or phone number associated with the account, please?

turns.speaker: agent
turns.utterance: Thank you. One moment while I access your account... Okay, I see the charge. It appears there was a temporary promotional discount that expired last month, returning the plan to its original price of $75. Did you receive any notification about this?

turns.speaker: user
turns.utterance: No, I didn't! That's ridiculous. I never would have signed up at that price. Is there anything you can do? I really can't afford this.

turns.speaker: agent
turns.utterance: I understand. Let me see what options are available. I can offer you a different plan that is closer to the $50 price point. It has slightly less data, though. Would you be interested in hearing about that?

turns.speaker: user
turns.utterance: How much less data are we talking? And why wasn't I notified about the price increase in the first place? Isn't that illegal or something?

turns.speaker: agent
turns.utterance: The new plan has 5GB less data per month. Regarding the notification, our policy is to send an email 30 days prior. Please check your spam folder. I can also manually add a note to your account to ensure you receive future notifications via text message as well. As for legality, our terms of service allow for promotional pricing adjustments with proper notification. Would you like me to proceed with explaining the details of the new plan?
